posts.post_content: While it has been a faithful companion, your Companion Cube cannot accompany you through the rest of the test. If it could talk - and the Enrichment Center takes this opportunity to remind you that it cannot - it would tell you to go on without it, because it would rather die in a fire than become a burden to you.

posts.post_content: This card is a dark ritual that can interact with artifact effects ([Tinker](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Tinker)) and the mana can be used on any turn after you cast it. PLUS it can be untapped for later use by paying 4 mana or through more interaction ([Voltaic Key](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Voltaic Key)). I think you all know how good dark ritual is. This thing is dark ritual on steroids in the right deck, trust me.

posts.post_content:
Dream hand: 1 land, 1 mana vault, 3 [voltaic key](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=voltaic key), 2 [thran dynamo](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=thran dynamo).   
Turn one: play land, mana vault, 1st voltaic key, untap and reuse mana vault, play 1st Thran dynamo, play 2nd voltaic key, untap and reuse dynamo or vault, play 2nd Dynamo, play 3rd voltaic key, untap Mana Vault. Alternatively the 3rd voltaic key could be a [doubling cube](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=doubling cube) instead.   
Turn two: Draw Emrakaul and play him from your hand (and still have one mana spare)!  
In response your opponent then taps their one swamp and uses a [dark ritual](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=dark ritual) to play [Diabolic Edict](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Diabolic Edict) and you start weeping like a baby, while plotting your revenge...  
  
New Dream hand: 1 [Ancient Tomb](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ancient Tomb), 4 Mana Vaults, 2 Voltaic Keys.   
Turn one: Play Ancient Tomb, play 2 mana vaults, use them to play 2 more mana vaults and 2 voltaic keys, untap your used mana vaults ready for turn two.   
Turn two: Use everything for 18 colourless mana (!) then p... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

Posted By: Wizard-of-the-Toast (4/19/2011 4:00:23 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Time to make the spikes cringe!  
How about some casual uses for those of us not intent on abusing fun but powerful artifacts?  
[Braid of fire](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Braid of fire) is not a bad way to get repeat value out of both cards. For a cost of ![1](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=1&type=symbol), you can transfer ![3](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=3&type=symbol) from your upkeep to your main phase.   
It also forms a nice two card combo with [soulbright flamekin](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=soulbright flamekin).  
Turn 1: land, mana vault  
Turn 2: land, Soulbright  
Turn 3: land, something that can use ![Red](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=R&type=symbol)![Red](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=R&type=symbol)![Red](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=R&type=symbol)![Red](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=R&type=symbol)![Red](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=R&type=symbol)![Red](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=R&type=symbol)![Red](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=R&type=symbol)![Red](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=R&type=symbol)  
Playing this without a means to untap it is not worth it if you are planning on games going 10+ turns.   
And now to go for broke: use black lotus to power out a [Celestial Prism](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Celestial Prism) on the first turn!
posts.html:
Time to make the spikes cringe!
How about some casual uses for those of us not intent on abusing fun but powerful artifacts?
Braid of fire is not a bad way to get repeat value out of both cards. For a cost of , you can transfer from your upkeep to your main phase.
It also forms a nice two card combo with soulbright flamekin.
Turn 1: land, mana vault
Turn 2: land, Soulbright
Turn 3: land, something that can use
Playing this without a means to untap it is not worth it if you are planning on games going 10+ turns.
And now to go for broke: use black lotus to power out a Celestial Prism on the first turn!

posts.post_content:
I have a deck with all of these cards in it, but I doubt I'd ever draw this set up...  
  
Turn 1: [Ancient Tomb](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ancient Tomb) (or [Mishra's Workshop](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mishra's Workshop) if you're made of money), Mana Vault, [Voltaic Key](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Voltaic Key), [Voltaic Key](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Voltaic Key), [Chromatic Sphere](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Chromatic Sphere), [Tinker](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Tinker) dig for [Blightsteel Colossus](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Blightsteel Colossus), [Lightning Greaves](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lightning Greaves)  
  
Declare attackers...  
  
It'd have to be perfect though, or close to perfect, I guess you could top deck the Lightning Greaves or Tinker from the cantrip from Chromatic Sphere.
posts.html:
I have a deck with all of these cards in it, but I doubt I'd ever draw this set up...

Turn 1: Ancient Tomb (or Mishra's Workshop if you're made of money), Mana Vault, Voltaic Key, Voltaic Key, Chromatic Sphere, Tinker dig for Blightsteel Colossus, Lightning Greaves

Declare attackers...

It'd have to be perfect though, or close to perfect, I guess you could top deck the Lightning Greaves or Tinker from the cantrip from Chromatic Sphere.
